md:
giải nghĩa từ "revisited" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

**Revisited** (verb)

* Meaning: to visit or look at something again, especially in order to think about it or make changes to it.
* Vietnamese: quay lại thăm, quay lại xem xét, xem xét lại.

Example sentences:

* I revisited the museum last weekend to see the new exhibit. (Tôi quay lại thăm bảo tàng vào cuối tuần để xem triển lãm mới.)
* The company revisited their business strategy to adapt to the changing market. (Công ty quay lại xem xét chiến lược kinh doanh để thích ứng với thị trường thay đổi.)

**Related words:**

* Review: to look at or examine something again, often in order to make changes or improvements.
* Re-examine: to examine something again, often in order to make a new judgment or decision.
* Re-evaluate: to evaluate something again, often in order to make a new judgment or decision.

**Antonyms:**

* Ignore: to pay no attention to something.
* Disregard: to pay no attention to something or to ignore it.
* Overlook: to fail to notice or pay attention to something.

Note: The antonyms of "revisited" are words that imply not paying attention to something or ignoring it, whereas "revisited" implies going back to something to examine or think about it again.
